sections.title: Syntax
sections.text_content: drawfillbox (x1, y1, x2, y2, Color : int)

sections.title: Description
sections.raw_content: The drawfillbox procedure is used to draw a filled box on the screen with bottom left and top right corners of (x1, y1) to (x2, y2) filled using the specified Color. To get a box outlined in a different color, use drawfillbox with the Color parameter set to the fill color and then call drawbox with the Color parameter set to the border color.
sections.text_content: The drawfillbox procedure is used to draw a filled box on the screen with bottom left and top right corners of (x1, y1) to (x2, y2) filled using the specified Color. To get a box outlined in a different color, use drawfillbox with the Color parameter set to the fill color and then call drawbox  with the Color parameter set to the border color.
sections.mdown_content: The **drawfillbox** procedure is used to draw a filled box on the screen with bottom left and top right corners of (*x1*, *y1*) to (*x2*, *y2*) filled using the specified *Color*. To get a box outlined in a different color, use **drawfillbox** with the *Color* parameter set to the fill color and then call **drawbox**  with the *Color* parameter set to the border color.

sections.title: Example
code:
setscreen ("graphics")
        drawfillbox (0, 0, maxx, maxy div 2, 1)
        drawbox (0, 0, maxx, maxy div 2, 2)
sections.raw_content: This program will fill the bottom half of the screen with color 1 and then outline it in color 2. The maxx and maxy functions are used to determine the maximum x and y values on the screen. The point (0,0) is the left bottom of the screen and (maxx, maxy) is the right top.

sections.title: Details
sections.raw_content:
The meaning of the Color number depends on the current palette. See the palette statement.

The screen should be in a "graphics" mode. See the setscreen procedure for details. If the screen is not in a "graphics" mode, it will automatically be set to "graphics" mode.
